Hyndburn shares 37 suppliers with its neighbouring East Lancashire councils, with combined spending of £28.1 million across these shared suppliers. Comparing what different councils pay the same companies reveals striking price variations that demand explanation.

The 115,237% Price Gap

The most extreme example is Walton Summit Truck Centre Ltd:

Council Average Payment
Burnley£56,000
Pendle£49
115,237% gap between highest and lowest average payment

While different councils will have different service requirements, a gap of this magnitude raises questions about procurement practices, contract terms, or potentially different services being purchased from the same supplier.

Lancashire County Council: The Dominant Recipient

Across all three councils, Lancashire County Council receives £72.6 million — by far the largest single recipient of district council spending. This reflects the two-tier local government structure where district councils pay the county for services like highways, social care, and waste disposal. But the sheer scale warrants scrutiny: are these inter-authority charges competitive, or simply accepted without challenge?

Key Takeaways

  • Hyndburn has the worst Companies House compliance — £1.1M to non-compliant suppliers, nearly 5x Burnley's exposure
  • Hyndburn has the worst year-end spike — at 12.9x, it dwarfs both neighbours
  • Hyndburn has the highest duplicate value — £3.4M, nearly £1M more than Burnley
  • Pendle processes the most transactions — 48,785 at an average of just £2,604, suggesting different administrative practices
  • 37 shared suppliers — with price variations that could indicate procurement inefficiency

The Case for Joint Procurement

With 37 suppliers already shared between the councils, there is a clear opportunity for joint procurement. If all three councils negotiated collectively with their shared suppliers, the combined spending power of £28.1 million would likely deliver better rates for all residents.

Cross-council analysis based on publicly available spending data from Hyndburn, Burnley, and Pendle Borough Councils. Supplier matching performed using normalised company names.
